summary: The "Stop Corrupt Iranian Oligarchs and Entities Act" directs the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of State and Director of National Intelligence, to submit a detailed report to Congress. This report must identify significant Iranian oligarchs and parastatal entities, detailing their wealth, corruption, and ties to the Iranian government. It also requires an analysis of the exposure of U.S. economic sectors to these individuals and entities, and the potential effects of imposing new sanctions or economic restrictions on them. The report is intended to inform future U.S. policy toward Iran.
